Package com.atakmap.math

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.math.Matrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMatrix, Disposable
    public final class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMatrix, Disposable
    Holds a 4x4 matrix for transforming points. The internal representation of the matrix is row major.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface gov.tak.api.engine.math.IMatrix

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(double m00,
              double m01,
              double m02,
              double m03,
              double m10,
              double m11,
              double m12,
              double m13,
              double m20,
              double m21,
              double m22,
              double m23,
              double m30,
              double m31,
              double m32,
              double m33)
        Creates a new matrix using the specified coefficients. The matrix coefficients are ordered in row major order.
        Parameters:
        m00 - The matrix coefficient at row 0, column 0
        m01 - The matrix coefficient at row 0, column 1
        m02 - The matrix coefficient at row 0, column 2
        m03 - The matrix coefficient at row 0, column 3
        m10 - The matrix coefficient at row 1, column 0
        m11 - The matrix coefficient at row 1, column 1
        m12 - The matrix coefficient at row 1, column 2
        m13 - The matrix coefficient at row 1, column 3
        m20 - The matrix coefficient at row 2, column 0
        m21 - The matrix coefficient at row 2, column 1
        m22 - The matrix coefficient at row 2, column 2
        m23 - The matrix coefficient at row 2, column 3
        m30 - The matrix coefficient at row 3, column 0
        m31 - The matrix coefficient at row 3, column 1
        m32 - The matrix coefficient at row 3, column 2
        m33 - The matrix coefficient at row 3, column 3

    • Method Detail

      • transform

        public PointD transform​(PointD src,
                        PointD dst)
        Transforms a point in the source coordinate space into the destination coordinate space. It is safe to use the same PointD instance for both src and dst.
        Parameters:
        src - The source point
        dst - The destination point. May be the same as src or null.
        Returns:
        dst or a newly allocated PointD instance if dst is null.

      • createInverse

        public Matrix createInverse()
                     throws NoninvertibleTransformException
        Creates the inverse of this matrix.
        Returns:
        The inverse of this matrix
        Throws:
        NoninvertibleTransformException - If this matrix could not be inverted

      • concatenate

        public void concatenate​(Matrix t)
        Concatenates this matrix with the specified matrix. Subsequent transformations with this transform will be equivalent to transforming first by t, then by this transform, prior to the concatenation.

        this = this X t

        Parameters:
        t - A matrix

      • preConcatenate

        public void preConcatenate​(Matrix t)
        Pre-concatenates this matrix with the specified matrix. Subsequent transformations with this transform will be equivalent to transforming first by this transform, prior to the pre-concatenation, then by t.

        this = t X this

        Parameters:
        t - A matrix

      • set

        public void set​(Matrix t)
        Sets the coefficients of this matrix to the coefficients of the specified matrix.
        Parameters:
        t - A matrix

        Transforms a point in the source coordinate space into the destination coordinate space. It is safe to use the same PointD instance for both src and dst.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        src - The source point
        dst - The destination point. May be the same as src or null.
        Returns:

      • inverse

        public boolean inverse()
        Description copied from interface: IMatrix
        Inverts this matrix. If the determinant of the matrix is 0.0, the matrix cannot be inverted and false will be returned.

        In the case where invert() is not successful, no change will be made to the matrix.

        Specified by:
        inverse in interface IMatrix
        Returns:
        true if the matrix was successfully inverted, false if it could not be inverted.

      • concatenate

        public void concatenate​(IMatrix t)
        Description copied from interface: IMatrix
        Concatenates this matrix with the specified matrix. Subsequent transformations with this transform will be equivalent to transforming first by t, then by this transform, prior to the concatenation.

        this = this X t

        Specified by:
        concatenate in interface IMatrix
        Parameters:

        public static Matrix mapQuads​(PointD src1,
                              PointD src2,
                              PointD src3,

                              PointD dst1,
                              PointD dst2,
                              PointD dst3,
                              PointD dst4)
        Creates a ProjectiveTransform that maps between a source and destination coordinate space. Coordinates should be specified in clockwise order, starting with the upper-left corner of the quadrilateral.
        Parameters:
        src1 -
        src2 -
        src3 -
        src4 -
        dst1 -
        dst2 -
        dst3 -
        dst4 -
